title: Grapes of wrath: Albania winemakers struggle with warmer world
description: The famously talented winemakers of Mirdita, high in the mountains of northern Albania, have never been so worried.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Scientists count huge melts in many protective Antarctic ice shelves. Trillions of tons of ice lost.
description: Four dozen Antarctic ice shelves have shrunk by at least 30% since 1997 and 28 of those have lost more than half of their ice in that time, reports a new study that surveyed these crucial "gatekeepers'' between the frozen continent's massive glaciers and open ocean.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Climate change is improving French wine—for now
description: What makes a good or bad year for wine? It's a question that vexes not only vintners but also scientists, who've long looked to weather conditions to provide the answer.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: A strategy to enhance the light-driven superconductivity of K₃C₆₀
description: Superconductivity is the ability of some materials to conduct a direct electrical current (DC) with almost no resistance. This property is highly sought after and favorable for various technological applications, as it could boost the performance of different electronic and energy devices.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Warming and habitat loss shrink pollinator numbers. That may hit coffee, cocoa crops hard in future
description: Changes in the climate and land use are combining to dramatically shrink the numbers of insects pollinating key tropical crops. As those problems interwine and intensify, it likely will hit coffee lovers right in the mug, according to a new study.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
